body: I have also created https://gist.github.com/quantatic/795af4d293f28608145d47cbab6ae23f for a more interactive example of this bug.

rename.to: [Bug]: session.defaultSession.getBlobData never resolves with blob sizes > 65536

rename.from: [Bug]: session.defaultSession.getBlobData never resolves with blob sizes > 65536
rename.to: [Bug]: session.getBlobData never resolves with blob sizes > 65536

body:
Electron 19.0.6 has this issue too.

How about this issue's progress?  

#6941

@deepak1556

@quantatic 
How did you get around this issue?

> @quantatic How did you get around this issue?

I wasn't able to get around this issue, this part of my application is still blocked on this bug.

@xland Certain Electron APIs (such as https://www.electronjs.org/docs/latest/api/structures/upload-data) only return blob UUIDs in certain situations. How do you advise getting the data from simply the blob UUID contained in `UploadData`?

I'm not a member of the electron team,
And I don't konw how to fix this issue,
I just want help.
I don't konw why @microwugui dislike my answer.

@quantatic 
I can't get the data of the `UploadData` object by `blobUUID` too.
In my case,I need to read a big file pice by pice
And the `File` object doesn't have path property (Print screen and paste into the electron app) 
I tried to post the file to the main process, and use `getBlobData` to read the data, I failed.
So I have to read the data by `slice` and `readAsArrayBuffer` method.
That's all.

> I'm not a member of the electron team, And I don't konw how to fix this issue, I just want help. I don't konw why @microwugui dislike my answer.
> 
> @quantatic I can't get the data of the `UploadData` object by `blobUUID` too. In my case,I need to read a big file pice by pice And the `File` object doesn't have path property (Print screen and paste into the electron app) I tried to post the file to the main process, and use `getBlobData` to read the data, I failed. So I have to read the data by `slice` and `readAsArrayBuffer` method. That's all.

We are not talking about your case, so I dislike your helpless comment

In my case, I can't get `interceptBufferProtocol` work as I expect because `getBlobData` not returned on large data

We need to focus on the issue not any other workaround, thx
